topicSummary: Superficial thrombophlebitis is a common disorder that occurs when a superficial vein becomes inflamed (phlebitis) and the blood within it clots.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Thrombophlebitis - superficial: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Correction made to supporting information on fondaparinux.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: The dose of clarithromycin for people with severe renal impairment has been clarified, in line with the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: The information on the concurrent use of clarithromycin or erythromycin with statins has been clarified.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in April 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. No major changes have been made to the recommendations; however, fondaparinux has now been included as a drug option for deep vein thrombosis (DVT) prophylaxis in people with superficial thrombophlebitis who are judged to be at increased risk of a DVT. Additional sections on the prognosis and complications of superficial thrombophlebitis as well as antibiotics prescribing information have also been added.
